httpserver

Class HTTPRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • httpserver.HTTPRequest

  • public class HTTPRequest
extends java.lang.Object
    An HTTPRequest takes an incoming connection and parses out all of the relevant data, supposing the conneciton follows HTTP protocol.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HTTPRequest

        public HTTPRequest(java.net.Socket connection)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   java.net.SocketException,
                   HTTPException
        Used to parse out an HTTP request provided a Socket and figure out the handler to be used.
        Parameters:
        connection - The socket between the server and client
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.net.SocketException
        HTTPException - when something that doesn't follow HTTP spec occurs

    • Method Detail

      • determineHandler

        public HTTPHandler determineHandler()
        Figure out what kind of HTTPHandler you want, based on the path. This returns a new object of that class. Just learning that Java has this capability really impressed me, I wouldn't have thought Java could do this.
        Returns:
        a new instance of some form of HTTPHandler.

      • setRequestLine

        public void setRequestLine(java.lang.String line)
                    throws HTTPException
        Sets the requestLine, and all derived items. Based off of the passed in line, the request type, request path, and request protocol can be set.
        Parameters:
        line - The first line in an HTTP request
        Throws:
        HTTPException

      • getRequestLine

      • setFullPath

        public void setFullPath(java.lang.String inPath)
        Set the full path, and path list. Because the path list is derived from the full path, it's set at the same time.
        Parameters:
        inPath - The full requested path (in `/path/to/request` form)

      • getFullPath

        public java.lang.String getFullPath()
        Gets the full path of the request.
        Returns:
        The full path.

        public java.lang.String getPath()
        Gets the path relative to the handler's path.
        Returns:
        Everything in the path after the handler's path.
